website_summaries.verdict: A light-duty cart that handles stairs very well. Use it for smaller loads (groceries and so on).
pros: decreases the amount of physical effort required by the user
It "walks" over steps or curbs and is great for moving smaller items around the home
cons: If you're looking for a hand truck to help you move larger appliances, this is not the best choice

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but limited use
customer_reviews.text: I was so impressed with the videos of this cart that I knew I wanted one. It folds well, is a champ on stairs, and is easy to manage. There is one design flaw that sort of changes my plans for its use. The hinges are in the way if one wants to haul plastic storage boxes or larger boxes. Round things fit well, and smaller or things put in the bag would work. I wanted to use it like a dolly, it is limited. The platform and space between the hinges is only 16 1/2 inches. I wanted it to move my big heavy sewing machine that is over 20 inches wide.
customer_reviews.author: Gram

customer_reviews.title: Depends on the height of the step of your stairs ...
customer_reviews.text: Depends on the height of the step of your stairs. If higher then the cart wheels height, you end up have to drag it up anyways.
customer_reviews.author: sandi hanna

customer_reviews.title: Wheels broken
customer_reviews.text: Had this less than two months. My wife has a condition with her neck, and she was carrying a backpack on it to and from class and had to go up and down stairs. Tonight, the frame connected to the wheels on one side of the cart broke making the cart unusable. The cart received only lightweight use. It was already a problem because it would fold up while it was being used, for no reason. Worked well when it was working except for the folding up. The company has been very forthcoming about sending a replacement and a return prepaid shipping label. We are awaiting the arrival of the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: HWS

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: One of the wheel just came off the cart, still usable but does not seem well made.
customer_reviews.author: STP

customer_reviews.title: Helped a lot carrying dozens of heavy tile packs to the third floor.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and his friend tiled our house floor and he has bad back. The packs of tiles were so heavy, and I was so worried about his back, he had to carry them to the third floor. I bought this, my husband thought it was too flimsy, that it wouldn't work, but I proved him wrong! It lasted the whole time they tiled the whole house, went up and down the stairs to the third floor so many times and my husband didn't hurt his back. Now we are lending it to a neighbour who's tiling his second floor. It well worth the invest. I'm so happy I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: manekineko

customer_reviews.title: folds up real small, but you are limited to ...
customer_reviews.text: folds up real small,but you are limited to a load that is 13" wide to fit between the wheel supports,and when there is a load on it there is no axle to put your foot on to help tilt the load back.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Schofield

customer_reviews.title: ... it for my 80 year old mother with a bad back. She loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my 80 year old mother with a bad back. She loves it. It climbs with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah P.

customer_reviews.title: Great product and works great on stairs. But one big disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, with one flaw, hard to get a bigger box on it and has a weird design where it's not flat across the back so hard to get a box to sit on it properly.
customer_reviews.author: KER

customer_reviews.title: Brackets protrude into platform area so you can't place object ...
customer_reviews.text: Brackets protrude into platform area so you can't place object immediately against the back. Flimsy and broke the first time I used it for something heavy. Not the seller's fault.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: IMPOSSIBLE TO CLOSE FOR ANYOBE WHO HAS ARTHRITIS OR IS ELDERY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I am 61 and live alone. Although it is easier somewhat going up, since I am 5'8 it is a bit too short and much bending is needed to go down. The biggest problem with this is it is so hard to close. So hard. People getting this are not in top shape to wrestle with this thing on your lap or bending for 15-20 min to close. I want to recommend it but cannot
customer_reviews.author: debbie

customer_reviews.title: comes handy
customer_reviews.text: after two uses the screw came off from the wheel and lost the screw, had to go Home depot to find machine screws.. wish the wheel more of heavy duty and like a beach tire make it easter on steps than banging the step from that wheel that came with it..
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Works great up our stairs to the 2nd floor. It was too wide for our attic stairs. It's a little heavier than I thought it would be. The springs at the corners make it so the box you're carrying cannot lie flush with the upright portion if it's wider than the springs. But, you are still able to put a wider box there unlike some of the other versions of a stair cart where the wheels get in the way. Overall I would recommend. Makes it so I can pull with one hand, and keep the other hand on the handrail.
customer_reviews.author: Tulsa Twinmom

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. Makes it much easier and safer to drag the groceries, suit cases, etc. up the stairs. Quality seems to be very good.
customer_reviews.author: M. Green

customer_reviews.title: Only good for really small boxes.
customer_reviews.text: You can't fit boxes that bigger then the 2/3 of the fork, its useless and waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Not so hefty.
customer_reviews.text: This cart cannot handle real life use. The front leg has snapped after only a few days, despite careful use and not exceeding the weight limit. The triple wheel design is very good and it does make transporting easier but this cart is too wimpy. I am planning on a return
customer_reviews.author: Supercommuter

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I got this one
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a back saver. I am glad I got this one. I do wish the platform was a little bigger or even adjustable. It will not take wider boxes. Also, It might help sometimes to use an extra bungee cord to hold things together if you have taller things.
customer_reviews.author: Ads

customer_reviews.title: Another great deal from Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: This cart is amazing, I can get all my groceries in the house in 1 or 2 trips instead of a dozen. So easy to use and sturdy. My only 2 complaints are that the wheels are so wide apart that it doesn't fit on my narrow sidewalk to my side porch, the other is that it doesn't turn very well. All in all I still love it and not only would recommend it to friends and family, but have recommended it to them. Also the best price is right here on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Gracean Hope

customer_reviews.title: It Broke The First Time I Used It
customer_reviews.text: It broke the very first time I used it. I got a heavy box in the mail and used the UpCart to get it from my front porch to the garage. After all, it is a "stair climbing" cart. I got the box on and started down the 3 steps. The plastic (!) support under the floor of it cracked off. I had the UpCart for a month or two before I used it so I didn't think I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: janet and Russell maugans

customer_reviews.title: Perfect wheel placement & superior design
customer_reviews.text: Far better than an industrial strength model I purchased previously. Excellent build quality; ingenious design and folds flat for exceptionally compact storage. MOST IMPORTANT: Wheels are placed in relation to one another so that the dolly does not scrape the edge of the stairs as it descends. This issue was the most significant problem with my prior model.
customer_reviews.author: M. Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Limitations not described
customer_reviews.text: Because of its design nothing wider than a bankers box could be moved on the all terrain stair climber. That made it unusable for us. This should have been explained in the product description. The supplier did allow us to return it and took care of the return postage
customer_reviews.author: Alan Rothstein

customer_reviews.title: Nothing's worth throwing your back out.
customer_reviews.text: I have a basement. I have to carry heavier than I should handle things down there. This product has saved my back. It goes upstairs and downstairs like a champ. Stuck an 80 lb. air compressor on it and had no problem getting it down in the basement. It's compact when collapsed. It's always got 4 wheels on the ground so turning is a little harder, but not a problem. Adjustable length handle comes in handy every time. We use it to carry cases of water and soft drinks from the car into the house. Every house with steps needs one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like this cart
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cart! It does exactly what they claim! That alone is fairly amazing. What is does NOT do well is roll on gravel, and I have a ton of it. It still works, even on gravel, and is SO much easier to use than anything I've tried before. I suspect that I will have to replace the wheels one of these days, but it works so well for stairs and moving things inside, that I am not really complaining. Just know that if you have a gravel driveway or paths, it will be harder to pull and will probably stress the wheels into a somewhat early failure. That is NOT a deal breaker for me. :)
customer_reviews.author: Kate Winner

customer_reviews.title: Great idea BUT one significant flaw
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, excellent construction, works great BUT the hinges on either side of the platform restrict width of item to transport. For example, trying to roll a standard cooler down stairs and can't just lay it across the platform like with a regular dolly. Even with straps you have to balance it all whomper jawed. Can't rest the item up against the back of the dolly like with other traditional 2 wheelers. Maybe I'm missing something...
customer_reviews.author: dclair

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I gave Upcart only 4 stars because large items don't sit flush against the frame, and lack of instructions Two 32 count 16 Oz water cases I brought into house did not sit flush against the frame. This is caused by the wheel clearance and brace connecting frame the to Nose, yes that is the name of the vertical section of hand truck. It worked but when I stop moving it wanted to tip over. Additionally the directions were very basic and I had to "figure out" how to collapse the cart when done.
customer_reviews.author: Eric D Underhill

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This does not seem to reduce the weight very much. I can put a case of water on it and when going up to the second floor of my apartment it is easier and more quiet to carry it. I bought it for my girlfriend to use in case I am out of town and she would rather carry a case of water then drag it up the stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy cart
customer_reviews.text: The first thing to know is that this is not for moving heavy articles. I have found it poorly made. there are load bearing, moving parts that are made of plastic that break easily and screws that come unscrewed. I am giving it 3 stars because they have great customer service. When I sent them notification that I had to replace a screw and that the platform had broken they immediately replaced both items at no charge, BUT the replacement was also plastic.
customer_reviews.author: suzybcool

customer_reviews.title: Everything I expected, with one minor exception. The ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything I expected, with one minor exception. The bungee cord that came with the cart was not well-constructed. In addition, with a load too bulky to fit in the bag, I needed two bungee cords to keep everything together. Two sturdier cords from Home Depot solved the problem. The UpCart has been very helpful moving boxes and other items from the garage to the inside of my condo house and from the basement to the main level. On a recent vacation, several people asked about it when I used it to carry items from the car into motel rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Sue M.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says. Goes up and down stairs easily. Kind of useless though as any item that is wide can not be put on this as there are brackets at the bottom edge that prevent anything from laying flat on the platform (like Christmas storage bins, end tables, etc - things that a device like this would be perfect for). I highly doubt we'll get much use out of it. We were really looking forward to having an easy way to bring up and down Christmas and other decor supply bins.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: ... am a female who thought this was such a great idea and the size was not as intimidating as ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a female who thought this was such a great idea and the size was not as intimidating as the bigger dollies. Love how it folds up and out of the way but if I have one complaint it would be that when it is opened you can only fit something that will go between the the inside of the wheels because of the extended brackets. You cannot really lay something the wide way because the brackets are in the way. I still use it and love how it goes up and down the stairs and would recommend it for smaller items.
customer_reviews.author: michigander

customer_reviews.title: UpCart solves a major problem! Yea!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Up Cart has done a great job with this cart. Used it a number of times already and it works on stairs flawlessly! I'm a little worried about the load volume because I've seen the wheels bending when I make a turn - might need to be a little more robust for turns with heavier items, AND you really can't expect folks only to use it when going straight!! I'll keep you posted. So far it's been an incredible back saver when bringing things up stairs. What a simple and great idea!
customer_reviews.author: bigeasy

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP PIECE OF CRAP....DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product. The videos looked like it would work really well. Okay, I used this thing ONE time and it broke! I put a few items totaling maybe 40 pounds on it to move. I tilted the cart back and the wheels buckled and the back broke. Piece of crap. It is supposed to be able to move up to 100 pounds. Nope. My suggestion is NOT TO BUY THIS CART!. It will break. Like I said before I only used it once since buying it in March. I feel very ripped off. It was not that inexpensive......Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Christine K.

customer_reviews.title: The thing I dislike is it doesn't load from the ground like regular ...
customer_reviews.text: wasn't sure about this... but now that I have tried it up outdoor stairs and on the lawn, I am impressed. The thing I dislike is it doesn't load from the ground like regular hand trucks. you have to lift whatever you plan on hauling to the shelf. It isn't bad BUT if you can't hold the item you are picking up , you will not be able to move it with this hand truck. Other than that.. it is very strong, very durable and DOES do what it says. the wheels are totally amazing. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Kelley

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: Works well for steps that are flush and have a back to steps. Does not work well on stairs with no back. which is what I have in my apartment. So didn't help for what I needed, but if you have the other steps it works great. lightweight and folds nicely for storing away.
customer_reviews.author: LRS

customer_reviews.title: looked fantastic on TV
customer_reviews.text: The locking arms prevent 90% of its use. We are 65 and wanted it to go down steps with Christmas boxes from attic... looked fantastic on TV. But useless for us to bring Christmas boxes down from upstairs. Will have to return it. Unless you have narrow boxes to fit between the brackets ,(not between the wheels) it won't work.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest Wise

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This cart is really awesome. I was able to move a large fish tank and stand into my house by myself, and bring a mini fridge to work. The only thing I wish could be fixed is the wideness of the thing on the cart. As it is, you can't put anything wider than the distance between the wheels which I think limits the functionality of this thing. However, it is definitely a 5 star product, especially with a variety pack of bungee cords.
customer_reviews.author: caroline

customer_reviews.title: Works but could be better
customer_reviews.text: It can be awkward to get boxes or items to sit on the support. It does what I need it to do, bring things up and down the steps, but it's hard on the shoulders to pull things up and you need to have good control going down or it could get away from you. Overall, I would recommend it, but if there were a heavier duty one, I would get that instead. This one just doesn't seem as sturdy as it could be. Still worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Sievert

customer_reviews.title: no real advantage over regular wheels
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be well made and it folds easily. It doesn't have an easy way to carry it once it's folded, which would be nice since it's not all that light. I got it hoping it would help since I live on the 3rd floor with no elevator, but unfortunately the wheels don't really offer an advantage over stairs. Small bumps or the curb it works fine, but I have to dead-lift it up each stair, it doesn't offer any leverage.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great for carrying waters, etc. Goes easily up and down stairs.
customer_reviews.text: I love this cart and bag but it's a little too big for my purposes. I'm a teacher, so I wanted it to take stuff back and forth to school on a daily basis. I actually took the bag off and use it to move boxes, unload groceries, waters, etc. I bought a bungee cord to go with it. The bag can be used independently. The cart folds up flat. The only thing, while I was using it to help my granddaughter move into her dorm, I had trouble opening it and some part went thru my finger. Ouch! I'm glad I have it, it helps a lot with carrying stuff and it goes up and down steps easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this against my husbands advice.....bad move! The videos make it look so easy to pull things up the stairs. Well not true. With only one box on the cart I have to go backwards up the stairs pulling hard on each step. And going down stairs is so unsafe I only went down one stair and decided I would fall if I went any further. I do not recommend this product. The only good thing about it is it folds into a small unit to store - which is how it will remain in our home - in storage.
customer_reviews.author: Cforten5

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: We live on the third floor of an apartment building. The stair climber was a great help. We used it often. Then one day, the plastic stand that helps stabilize the unit broke off during a load of groceries going up the stairs. We got to the second landing and it simply lay down. the plastic stand simply folded on itself then broke. Now the skeleton just sits in the closet. If the unit would make this out of aluminum it would last longer and be able to support a heavier load of groceries perhaps. but over all, while it was working, we loved it. it was the best we had ever used.
customer_reviews.author: batia

customer_reviews.title: Good company
customer_reviews.text: I like it except that the front leg broke as shown in picture. Disappointing. I raised this from 2 stars to 5 BECAUSE the company is sending me a replacement part!! Wonderful!!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Ewen

customer_reviews.title: Great father's day gift for a handy dad
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my husband for father's day, he's always doing projects around the house & folks in the neighborhood. He opened it upon delivery & took it for a test spin up our deck steps (about 9 or 10 stairs) with my son's 110lb girlfriend strapped to it. No problems at all, all 3 wheels were used, the girlfriend stayed put & he used very little effort in the experimental. Great gift, woot-woot!!
customer_reviews.author: anitaj

customer_reviews.title: A Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: The UpCart is designed really well. When folded it is very flat and short. The three wheels make such a difference on steps. I have steps that turn at a right angle so the steps at the angle are short and this goes up and down them just fine. The included bag holds a lot. When I have small things to bring up from the basement all at once it reduces my trips. I haven't used it outside the house yet, but I'm sure it will serve me well there too. I bought a set of bungee cords to hold on cumbersome sizes of boxes and that works well. They can be wider than the platform.
customer_reviews.author: Lois

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Construction, Did Not Last A Day
customer_reviews.text: It lasted only one day. The black plastic part on the front is only attached to the frame of the cart by a tiny knob that is approximately 1/8th of an inch in height and diameter. That tiny knob broke, so the front piece fell off. The cart is now almost impossible to use. The handle on the cart is also very flimsy, like one you might see on a very cheap suitcase. For the $$$ I spent, I expected a much sturdier product. This almost looks like a prototype. I liked the three-wheel design, however. Maybe future versions of this product will be better?
customer_reviews.author: lil_applet

customer_reviews.title: Good for moving
customer_reviews.text: There's definitely a learning curve with figuring out how to use this thing. Have a lot of trouble folding and unfolding it correctly. And figuring out the angle on the stairs is difficult. It saves a lot of work when you're moving a small dresser or a heavy box. Just be careful of the weight limit because after all the wheels are made of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Ansel

customer_reviews.title: This product is poorly made. It has cracked and ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is poorly made. It has cracked and broken in several places. It's only been used 4 or 5 times. I store it neatly in my basement until I need it. I've reached out to the company and they refuse to refund or replace it. I can't even get it to fold down properly. I've reported the item to the BBB. This item should be taken off the market.
customer_reviews.author: April Guarini

customer_reviews.title: This worked like a charm for me when my portable (ha
customer_reviews.text: Not quite 5 Stars but definitely more than 4. It's light weight but very usable. Here's the thing that people have complained about. The width is too narrow. People, put something about 4" high that is 16" or less on the platform first, THEN put your wider item on top. This worked like a charm for me when my portable (ha!) airconditioner arrived with it's 24" width and 67 #s of weight (that's pounds for your hash-taggers out there). I'm 65 and a half years old, and this rolled right up to the 2nd floor.
customer_reviews.author: artelahe

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: We gave to our daughter who lives in second floor apartment in an old house with steep stairs. She loves it and uses it every day for for groceries, taking laundry to the basement and going to local markets in the summer. It is very sturdy. She had no problem transporting paint can upstairs. Sometimes she can be hard to buy for, but this was a total hit.
customer_reviews.author: satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I am 78 years old and some of my parts are not as strong as they used to be. This product has been a Godsend. I get a LOT of my things from Amazon to eliminate having to haul them to the car and then into the house BUT the box on the porch can sometimes be daunting. Now I tip the box onto the platform and secure the bungee and off I go...upstairs? No problem...downstairs? No problem. This product has made me feel like I can do it, again. PS: the videos were VERY helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: One huge problem
customer_reviews.text: It is a great design as far as the wheels and stair climbing and descending. Huge weakness is the plastic support legs on the front. They need to be metal, not plastic. The first time I used mine the plastic legs broke so the front is not supported adequately now and makes it difficult to keep anything on it unless it is tipped back. Change this huge flaw and it would be great.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Seely

customer_reviews.title: Upcart too heavy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Got it because I am a senior citizen thinking it would help me haul things up and down stairs but it was so heavy and bulky by the time you put anything on it was too heavy to move up or down stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for hauling document boxes up and down stairs
customer_reviews.text: Good news: the base really holds document boxes perfectly. Bad news: if the boxes are slightly bigger than a legal/letter box, the base-plate will hold up well but the side-to-side frame won't keep everything centered. I ended up buying a different UpCart for the bigger boxes but am keeping this one for hauling groceries up the stairs in my new townhouse (entrance is on the ground floor but kitchen is on the 2nd floor)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish the handle was taller because if you are on ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish the handle was taller because if you are on steep stairs, you have to bend over a little bit. Also, I thought this one came with the bag, but it didn't. Overall, it is helpful to take up and down the stairs with laundry, groceries, and large pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It stores great and is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The cart arrived yesterday and we are thrilled with it. It has already been used to move items up and down two flights of stairs. It is safe and efficient. It stores great and is easy to use. I am so glad I purchased this and will be recommending it to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Kay Newill

customer_reviews.title: good cart. we will see about its durability
customer_reviews.text: good cart. we will see about its durability... Does not turn easily under load due to 2 wheels on each side in constant contact with ground. Much easier to carry water/soda/drinks up my sidewalk steps. (4 levels + stoop) I got a "flat" bungee strap to hold cases which really helps out.
customer_reviews.author: bryan

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Seems very strong and easy to handle, once you are able to unfold it. The first one I got was almost impossible to open. They were very good about exchanging it. The second one wasn’t much better. I do think it will work very well however. Heavy, strong and very sturdy. Very good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: emilysmom

customer_reviews.title: The most uncomfortable item to deal with. It is ...
customer_reviews.text: The most uncomfortable item to deal with. It is heavy, does not run smooth and it is very difficult to handle. It is not worth the price. I am sorry I did not try as soon as I received it and when I tried to use it last week it was awful. Money completely lost.
customer_reviews.author: Blanky M. Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: No problems here. It moved ~40 lb. air conditioners up wooden stairs without a problem. Moved 18" logs across a lawn without a problem. You do need to provide your own bungee cords. It has not bent or buckled.
customer_reviews.author: JPPersch

customer_reviews.title: not so strong as advertise, the screew fall out ...
customer_reviews.text: not so strong as advertise, the screew fall out, wheel rip off after just one heavy lift . not ok for home usage
customer_reviews.author: binh

customer_reviews.title: HAVE USED THIS STAIR CLIMBING HAND TRUCK SEVERAL TIMES WHEN ...
customer_reviews.text: HAVE USED THIS STAIR CLIMBING HAND TRUCK SEVERAL TIMES WHEN MOVING OUT OF A LARGE HOUSE. I FOUND IT TO WORK VERY WELL FOR THE ENTIRE MOVE. BE AWARE OF ITS WEIGHT LIMITS AND DON'T ABUSE IT WITH ROUGH HANDLING AND YOU'LL FIND IT GETS THE JOB DONE. IF THEY BUILT A STURDIER TRUCK WITH BIGGER WHEELS, OF COURSE FOR MORE MONEY, I WOULD DEFINITELY BUY ONE !!
customer_reviews.author: Angela G

customer_reviews.title: There was 6 inches of snow on the ground but it worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This worked so well. My husband used it for the first time in March 2017. There was 6 inches of snow on the ground but it worked like a charm. He carried heavy decorative floor lamps that were awkward to handle right through the snow, up the steps and into the cabin! Love it!! I am going to purchase another for my 75 year old mother to use moving things from upstairs to first floor to basement. Like most of us, she struggles carrying things up and down stairs even though she is strong enough to carry the items.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Johnson

customer_reviews.title: The disappointing factor is that because of the brackets on ...
customer_reviews.text: The disappointing factor is that because of the brackets on the side of the platform you cannot place anything wider than the platform on the cart. I unfortunately purchased this for my boss as a gift because he often takes electronic equipment to off site meetings and presentations. The first time he tried to use it he was unable to because the items he need to take were wider than the platform. Unfortunately this was not discovered until well after the return period and now he is going to try to build up the platform in order to place his items above where the brackets interfere.
customer_reviews.author: Donna P.

customer_reviews.title: the cart works fine until one of the front bracket broke
customer_reviews.text: I live in Condo without elevator so I need this cart , have't use this since when I bought it, but time comes that I need it .so I test it. my unit is only 2nd floor . the cart works fine until one of the front bracket broke. I realize the bracket connectoris made of plastic.. not cool specially if your carrying heavy box, 3 tire's is is very useful in stairs, it really works. only some parts are very cheap the way its connect.it only works for a very light stuff. and short stairs .
customer_reviews.author: kik

customer_reviews.title: Very handy dandy cart!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing I have a back issue and this cart is the answer to my prayers! I can put stuff in the bag that came with my previous order the wheel gear broke so couldn’t use the older and smaller of the current one. I wished the bag is not so flimsy. I spite of that I can log stuff all over my workplace.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Kaylee

customer_reviews.title: 4 Stars. Great concept.  Needs a little bit more structure.
customer_reviews.text: Works as described for going up the stairs, however with about 85lbs feels like the over extended arm it's going to snap (they should've braced it). Also when taking a sharp 180 degree turn the wheels bend a little bit. Used it to carry luggage up to a 3rd floor and ultimately did the job.
customer_reviews.author: David Peretz

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight stability
customer_reviews.text: Stability for going up and down stairs. Only drawback is that you have to be able to lift what you are moving onto the cart. A regular dolly can be slid under something; this platform is about 4" off the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Walker Gardels

customer_reviews.title: MAkes moving heravy objects up steps very manageable. Watch going down.
customer_reviews.text: Makes moving items of any weight very easy to go up stairs using this tool. However, coming down stairs using it is another matter. One needs to really hang on or it will pull you a__ over tin cups going down steps. It wants to run away because it is do easy and unless your well in control you are going to have a problem. For a senior, great help getting a heavy item up the steps but coming down one better get some help.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Useful and easy to use device
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and easy to fold up unit. This is as good as my hand truck but much lighter and easier to fold and store. It says it can support 150 lbs but have not used it yet for that much weight. Comes with flat bungie a belt. Fours wheels help to pull up stairs. Nicely engineered but mostly hard plastic to make it lighter and cheaper to manufacture. Useful device.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this purchase.  Makes life a little easier.
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very pleased with this purchase. I use a box which fits exactly between the sides of the cart and makes it easy to hook the bungee cords on. I have learned not to fill it with too much weight. I go up two flights of stairs and did try and overload the box. That makes it hard to pull so now I make a few more trips and it is much easier. I am a senior citizen and those steps while carrying bags and boxes are getting more difficult for me. This UpCart does help and it actually works.
customer_reviews.author: NammyPop

customer_reviews.title: Runs smoothly, even across cobblestones, and negotiates the stairs
customer_reviews.text: Having just purchased a summer condo in town, where we are walking to the supermarket, and then taking groceries upstairs, life has been made easier with this cart. What's more, it has helped us get a 5' potted plant, and other heavy items from the car to the condo, and then upstairs. Would highly recommend this cart to anyone !!
customer_reviews.author: polo reader

customer_reviews.title: Very functional
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad that I purchased the UpCart. I am not supposed to do heavy lifting, so this has been a real back saver! It's very sturdy & can carry large boxes as well as smaller ones. It is very well made & comes with a flat bungee cord to secure the item you're moving. I highly recommend the UpCart.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Hennig

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I deliver groceries for a living and this cart is great for heavy cases of water, or other heavy items. I wish the base was a bit larger but it does the job. When climbing stairs, I wish it was a bit easier to pull up the stairs and a bit smoother but it does work and it can take a really heavy load! I love how compact it is as well, it's easy to open and close. I'm very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: TE

customer_reviews.title: Feels sturdy and goes up our 9" steps.
customer_reviews.text: Sofar I like it a lot. It's sturdy and wide enough to support s 50 pound dog food bag (I think). Collapsing the cart is a bit clumsy and hard to do for my wife, but I think after a while it will be easier as experience is gained. It got up our nonstandard steps (about 9") which was the main worry. Overall I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Frits

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Crappy design, one of the legs broke at the first use.
customer_reviews.author: aniko

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Awkward, too small base. Only good for about 20 pounds because anything heavier cannot be controlled. The bungee cord doesn't help secure or control the load. Easier to carry boxes yourself.
customer_reviews.author: sandyb

customer_reviews.title: Grateful to Have!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great seller response. I am losing mobility and strength. This cart looked good on seller page. My order tracking said it was left at my front door. I never saw it and contacted the seller. They, with no pause, said they would ship another cart. When it arrived and I unpacked it, it was all I had hoped to assist me. Well made, and climbs steps smoothly. To repeat, great product and even better seller!
customer_reviews.author: Doris Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Plastic, poor design, broke at half the rated weight
customer_reviews.text: Didn't last 10 days. The plastic support leg and plastic hinge holding it together broke when loaded with a 65lbs box, around half the rated weight. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: singhsays

customer_reviews.title: How blessed I feel having a product like this to help me keep my independence.
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed to help me keep my independence. I frequently have to carry heavy (for me) items up two flights of stairs. It moves easily up and down the stairs and over ramps and uneven surfaces. It is very sturdy, as well. I bought the flat bungee cords, but haven't used them yet. I know I will have to soon, but having used several other types of bungee cords, I can say that these seem ideal for the purpose. They are very strong., I have already called some of my friends to tell them about this.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn C.

customer_reviews.title: It's great once it's unfolded but 1) it's hard to open ...
customer_reviews.text: It's great once it's unfolded but 1) it's hard to open up: pushing down on the platform to get the wheels to open and 2) when you lift it out of the car the handle always slides down to full height which is awkward. Otherwise it works well for the purpose for which it was designed.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: I like that it's stury
customer_reviews.text: Given my health & age, this cart is so helpful. It's taking me awhile to learn just how much I can load in the cart given my shoulder injury..hope to load to capacity when phys therapy done. I like that it's stury, has, velcro tabs to keep the bag in place...having six wheels helps with outside cements steps
customer_reviews.author: Carol Daly

customer_reviews.title: This cart makes moving light loads up and down stairs easy
customer_reviews.text: This cart makes moving light loads on flat floors and stairs easy. It is not that great at moving things outside, across lawns for example, because of the small wheel size and somewhat flexible folding mechanisms. The folding mechanisms also tend to start to collapse (fold, not break) if the cart is overloaded.
customer_reviews.author: Jim L

customer_reviews.title: I managed to break the foot off the first day ...
customer_reviews.text: I managed to break the foot off the first day I had it. Why can't they just have the pickup arm rest on the ground?
customer_reviews.author: Murray

customer_reviews.title: This is great. The only thing that could or would make ...
customer_reviews.text: I have two story house with stairs both inside and outside and have been reorganizing. This is great. The only thing that could or would make it any better was a heavy duty attached strap for securing the items up and down. Bungies just aren't that good for furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mover and a shaker.
customer_reviews.text: Actually impressed with this item. The bag functions as a hamper attached to the wheels and works great up and down steps. I used the cart to move and it was smooth. It's not going to work on real heavy items, but then that's not why I bought it. It does travel well, goes up and down steps to move items and I've used it for luggage with some bungie cords.
customer_reviews.author: William Laughlin

customer_reviews.title: I bought three of these. Two as gifts. ...
customer_reviews.text: This lightweight little cart does an awesome job. Really saves on the lower back when going up of down stairs, over curbs, over obstacles or while using a gangway on a ship. I regret not buying one sooner. Folds small for storing.
customer_reviews.author: maxx12

customer_reviews.title: Back Saver
customer_reviews.text: Love this cart. I had to bring an upright AC unit up the stairs and this cart saved my back. I will be using it to help lug things up my basement stairs when I clean it out.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea M. Latzko

customer_reviews.title: this thing is useless. Not too sure about testing this weight limit ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely difficult to steer. The base is wide enough to fit a document box size only due to the way this cart is constructed to fold, with an angled beam on each side. If you need to lug document boxes up and down stairs, this will work. If you want to be able to place wider boxes or turn hallway corners, this thing is useless. Not too sure about testing this weight limit either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes the wheels start closing while the cart is pulled. Great idea for going up on stairs BUT need to keep it light so it makes it up not closing wheels
customer_reviews.author: ME

customer_reviews.title: Performs as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This cart helped a lot at a recent estate scale. The property has several levels and a deck, and entryways with steps. This hand truck makes moving heavy stuff easier and eliminates dropping cartons, damaging contents-- or toes!
customer_reviews.author: Martha Knight

customer_reviews.title: Save your back
customer_reviews.text: Great for taking objects up stairs and saving your back. BUT to utilize it you have to hold it tilted. Tray too small to set a box more than 12" square, standing upright.
customer_reviews.author: Red Sonja

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your $$$$$$$$$
customer_reviews.text: fell apart the second time it was used. bar across bottom of platform serves no purpose. Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Kathy&Ray

customer_reviews.title: Return of the UpCarts
customer_reviews.text: I returned both of them due to they were hard to control going down the steps and hard to pull with a load on back up the steps. I feel I was missed missed informed by the video in many ways.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: This product is perfect for taking things up and down stairs
customer_reviews.text: This product is perfect for taking things up and down stairs. It is easy to pull and I am using it to take laundry upstairs. I went and got a tall laundry basket that sits on the platform and I use a bungee cord to fasten it to the UpCart and then I just pull the cart upstairs. I just can't carry the laundry upstairs anymore and this is the answer to getting things up the stairs without having to struggle or make multiple trips. Thank you for creating such a marvelous and useful tool!!
customer_reviews.author: mrsdotcom

customer_reviews.title: Great product for an old lady.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for getting the tubs of cat litter up the stairs from the garage to the house. I am a 79 year old woman and carrying these was a lot for me to do. The cart makes it easy and I can handle this chore by myself now. I have also used it for other things as well. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen B. Connell

customer_reviews.title: My husband does our clothes washing and loves the upcart ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband does our clothes washing and loves the upcart for bringing our clothes up and down the stairs. I have only one problem with it he likes using it so much I am afraid to put any clothes in the laundry basket, I do the folding. Everyone we show this cart to can't believe how well it works.
customer_reviews.author: Torchy

customer_reviews.title: INCREDIBLE!!
customer_reviews.text: I've retired early and moved into a second floor apartment in Albuquerque. I'm single, and the movers were not good and left much in a storage unit downstairs. This thing actually climbs stairs, and works as advertised. Today I had too much weight on it, and the bottom folding mechanism and legs snapped lose--I thought it was broken, but it all snapped right back into place. An excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like the concept
customer_reviews.text: Like the concept, but is made of mostly plastic. I have been using it approx 2 months for my job and it broke today. For what it cost I certainly thought it would hold up better. If I were to redesign it, the base would be wider and longer, and made of metal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Braces affect performance.
customer_reviews.text: Triple-wheel design works on stairs with flanged steps. However, I don't have steps without closed risers. My only complaint is that it has the braces on both sides of the lifting platform that gets in the way of boxes that you might lift. Bags of softener salt are easier; the braces don't affect the performance with those. It seems as sturdy as other folding carts.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F

customer_reviews.title: I thought this was going to make that task very easy! And it does help
customer_reviews.text: I have 15 steps to get into my house and my husband can't help bring in groceries any more. I thought this was going to make that task very easy! And it does help. I strapped a plastic trash can to it and put my bags in that. But I'm still lugging 50-60 lbs. up 15 stairs several times. Could you send me a strong 15 year old boy to help? HAHAHAHA!
customer_reviews.author: Charmaine O'Rourke

customer_reviews.title: Stair cart
customer_reviews.text: I didn't believe this would work I see on tv but I went up 2 flights of stairs no problem. I recommend you get some nice bunge cords to hold your item on if the box or basket is a little large. Collapses to easily take with you in car.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Harrington

product_meta.title: UpCart with Bag Bundle All-Terrain Stair Climbing Folding Cart Moves up to 100-pounds
product_meta.description: Style:Original| Size:Cart and bag bundleUpCart combines an all-terrain three-wheel chassis with a folding hand cart. Our unique engineering means that it is just as capable of bringing home the groceries with ease at it is hauling a 100 lbs. cabinet up multiple stairwells to your fifth floor apartment. It also folds to a depth of just over four inches, allowing for convenient storage. This combo comes complete with UpCart Original and UpGrade Bag for UpCart.
feature_bullets: The three-wheel design allows the UpCart to "walk" over curbs, stairs and obstacles.
Four wheels in contact with the ground at all times makes it easier for you to handle.
Built To Last: made from precision cast aluminium alloy parts
Folds to a depth of just over four inches, allowing for convenient storage.
Bundle includes bag with carrying capacity up to 12 gallons

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars824 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
